entry.title: Re: What is the difference between the maintain and update permission in SAC
entry.content: I believe your looking at the role for Dimension updates? If yes, "Update" allows users to modify the dimension's structure, including adding, removing, or renaming properties or hierarchies. "Maintain" allows users to add members to a dimension, but not to change its fundamental structure.

entry.title: Re: How can we implement automatic QM inspection lot with...
entry.content:
Ramned

I see you are trying to use inspection lot of type 04, but have in mind that this is inspection type is based of GR. The trigger for the creation of inspection lot 04 is the Goods receipt. The option is to use the inspection type 13, creating the inspection lots manually for the planned order. This link seems to address your problem.

Solved: QM In Repetitive Manufacturing - Inprocess and f... - SAP Community

If they want to use the 04 inspection lot, the creation is upon GR. You can't create a inspection lot not assigned to a goods movement (GR/storage location transfer) and expect it to be stock relevant.

Best of luck!

entry.title: Re: (Custom) Idoc: issue when changing data type of a field
entry.content:
You have to remember what an IDoc is and how it is stored. Each segment is effectively a data container with the data of the segment stored in EDID4-SDATA with each field being located within a specific offset of the overall data container.  If you lengthen one field then you have stretched its contents to a space previously contained by some other data element.  Hence, if you want to lengthen a field what you are in effect doing is creating a new IDoc version, which is how you would manage that from a technical point of view without affecting older IDocs.

 

Regards,

Ryan Crosby

entry.title: Option to select during SWPM System export, during size of source data screen
entry.content:
Hello All,

We are planning to migrate our system from SQL Server to HANA DB (Heterogeneous Migration).

During the source system export process (currently running on SQL Server), we encountered the following screen.

Kindly assist in choosing the appropriate option:

Option A: Use data dictionary information

Option B: Use database-specific implementation

Please help clarify the following points:

1. What are the purpose and advantages of Option A and Option B?

2. Are these options applicable universally across all database types, or are they specific to SQL Server DB?

3. Which option offers the most advantages across all database types. and which one should be selected

4.Also please confirm whether the option selection depends on the type of migration also—heterogeneous or homogeneous.
If so, kindly specify which option is recommended for each scenario, regardless of the database platform.

Regards
Appuru

Nevertheless I tested your suggestion. I set the in-house production time to 5 days and the total replenishment lead time to 22 days. The configuration for Scope of Check includes RLT (the checkbox is not set). entry.title: Re: Simplify how users find and share data: new AI features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (250
entry.content:
Hi Prashanth,

I am sorry to have missed this comment. The quick answer is that yes: accepting the limited promotion is mandatory to use the features before the upcoming 2508 release. At the end of the promotional period, the features will be deactivated so that you do not have to worry about additional charges. 

With the 2508 release, commercialization details will be updated for the solutions featured in the limited promotion. Stay tuned for announcements or reach out to your account executive for more details. 

Kind regards,
Conrad

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere catalog - Harvesting from SAP BW/4HANA
entry.content:
Hi @BabuSathya Thank you for your suggestions. I am still facing Privilege error while creating remote system in Datasphere using live tunnel connection for my SAP BW/4 2023 SP05 system. Below are the checks I performed -

* I tested the BW/4HANA end points and they are working fine.

* I checked the BW Metadata Extraction service via transaction /IWFND/V4_ADMIN and all the below mentioned services and service groups are added in my BW/4 system.

* I checked the cloud connector and below resources are added for my BW/4 system -

sap/bc/http/sap/bw4/v1/system/information
sap/opu/odata4/sap - Path & All sub-paths
/sap/opu/odata4/sap/rv_i_dwc_area_tree_sb/ - Path and all sub-paths
/sap/opu/odata4/sap/rv_c_dwc_obj_header/ - Path and all sub-paths
/sap/opu/odata4/sap/rv_i_dwc_details_sb/ - Path and all sub-paths

* I tried to install SAP note 3570254 but its showing me 'Not relevant' for my BW/4 system hence I installed latest SAP note 3601550 which installed successfully.

Thanks & Regards, Puneet

How do we impact the initial ATP check, to not confirm order on the closed plant and go for substitution instead. 

As per aATP the substitution works only when the initial ATP does not confirm quantity.

entry.title: Re: Developer Extensibility Public Cloud - QR code
entry.content:
Hello @lvbarat 

Adobe Forms in S/4HANA Public Cloud cannot convert a plain QR string into a QR image on its own. Even though you receive the QR string (like from the GST portal), you need to:

  • Convert that string into a QR code image (PNG or BMP).
  • Base64-encode the image.
  • Pass the Base64 string to the form XML so it can be displayed as an embedded image.

That’s how SAP expects QR codes to be handled in custom forms.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Data replication framework (DRF) setup in S4 public c...
entry.content:
Hello @FlorisBoon 

There’s no specific Best Practice scope item for DRF master data replication from SAP S/4HANA Public cloud Edition to decentralised EWM, but it’s fully supported.

Steps to follow,

  • Use Communication Arrangement SAP_COM_0247 for Product and Business Partner replication.
  • Trigger replication via Replicate by Replication Model App DRF_ADHOC_REPLICATION ()
  • Set up filtering and key mapping as needed (to handle old prefixes).
  • Monitor errors using Application Log or Application Logs-App ID F1487

Basic Integration with SAP Extended Warehouse Management (SAP EWM)

Migrating On-Premises Connectivity from Neo Environment to Cloud Foundry Environment

Data Replication Framework

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) のプロビジョニングガイド
entry.content:
本ブログはSAP Business Data Cloud(SAP BDC)のプロビジョニング方法についてガイドします。
※本ブログの原文はこちらです。また、最新アップデート情報の確認のために、併せてSAP BDCのマニュアルもご確認ください。

このシリーズは、次の 5 つブログで構成されます。

Part 1: SAP for Me によるSAP BDCのプロビジョニング
Part 2: SAP Datasphere のプロビジョニング
Part 3: SAP Analytics Cloud のプロビジョニング
Part 4: SAP Databricks のプロビジョニング、
Part 5: インテリジェント アプリとデータ パッケージのインストール

今回は、「Part 1: SAP for Me によるSAP BDCのプロビジョニング」です。

 

Part 1: SAP for Me によるSAP BDCのプロビジョニング

本ブログでは、SAP for Meを通じてSAP Business Data Cloudをプロビジョニングする方法について説明します。
管理者ロールを持つユーザーは次のタスクを実行することができます。
• SAP for Me 内で SAP Business Data Cloudをプロビジョニングし、「Business Data Cloud」システムを構成します。
• SAP Business Data Cloud Cockpit にログインします。
• SAP Business Data Cloud Cockpit へのユーザーアクセスを管理します。
• SAP Datasphere および SAP Analytics Cloud に Intelligent Applicationsをインストールします。
• SAP Datasphere にインストールするためにData Packageをアクティブ化します。
•「Business Data Cloud」構成に追加されたシステムの接続を監視します。

前提条件：
SユーザーIDが必要です。SユーザーIDを持つユーザーは、SAP for Me内でSAP Business Data Cloudのシステムを参照およびプロビジョニングできます。このSユーザーIDは、SAP BDCのオーダーの際に指定したBDC Entitlement Set(権限セット)が付与されている顧客アカウントにリンクされているIDである必要があります。

Business Data Cloudにアクセスするための手順 :

以下の手順は、BDC コックピットを最初にプロビジョニングする方法を説明します。

  1. SAP For Meにログオン
  2. ポートフォリオと製品に移動
  3. SAP for Me の SAP Business Data Cloudには、SAP Business Data Cloud アプリケーション、各アプリケーションにプロビジョニングされたソリューションの数、およびそれらに割り当てられた計画クォータが表示されます。
  4. このダッシュボードにアクセスし、ガイド付きのプロセスを通じてSAP Business Data Cloudのアプリケーションを簡単にプロビジョニングおよび統合することができます。
  5. SAP Business Data Cloudで有効なキャパシティユニット数と、SAP Business Data Cloud に含まれるソリューション間での割り当てが表示されます。SAP Business Data Cloud Core に割り当てられるキャパシティユニットの数は、ライセンス数に基づきます。
  6. SAP Business Data Cloudで「アプリケーションに移動」をクリックすると、SAP Business Data Cloud のプロビジョニングと統合ダッシュボードにアクセスでき、ガイド付きプロセスを通じて簡単にプロビジョニングと統合を行うことができます。
  7. ダッシュボードは中央ハブとして、SAP Business Data Cloud内のアプリケーションに対してインストールすることができます。
  8. アプリケーションタブを開くと、すべてのタイルが無効になっており、SAP Business Data Cloudコックピットを有効にする必要があることを示すメッセージが表示されます。「今すぐ有効にする」と強調表示されます。
  9. まず、名前を指定してリソースグループに割り当て、BDC Core製品を有効にします。リソースグループがまだ存在しない場合は作成してください。
  10. 「次へ」ボタンをクリックします。
  11. 「パラメータの設定」セクションで、リージョン、データセンター、所有者のメールアドレスを選択します。注: SAP Business Data Cloud Coreとそのソリューションが同じデータセンターにプロビジョニングされていることを確認してください。
  12. 「レビュー」をクリックします。
  13. 必要に応じてパラメータを修正し、準備ができたら「完了」をクリックします。
  14. 指定したリソースグループ内のテナントを表示するには、「リソースで表示」をクリックします。
  15. リソースタブでは、ソリューションのステータスは「処理中」で、プロビジョニングが完了すると「準備完了」に変わります。
  16. プロビジョニング時に指定されたSAP Business Data Cloudのシステム所有者は、テナントがプロビジョニングされると電子メール通知を受け取ります。
  17. プロビジョニングが完了すると、「顧客ランドスケープ」タブの下に新しくプロビジョニングされたテナントが表示され、そこに提供されているテナントリンクを通じてテナントに直接アクセスすることもできます。
  18. 「アプリケーションタブ」に戻ると、SAP Business Data Cloudに含まれる製品のタイルが有効になり、プロビジョニングを開始できます。
  19. テナントの準備ができたら、「リソース」タブの下のリンクとテナントの詳細からテナントにアクセスできるようになります。
  20. 「顧客ランドスケープ」では、新しいテナントのシステムの詳細を確認できます。また、システム統合が視覚的に表示されるため、システムランドスケープを理解しやすく、操作しやすくなります。
  21. 次のステップとして、「フォーメーション」を作成し、SAP Business Data Cloudコックピット/テナントと他のプロビジョニングされたテナントを統合する必要があります。
  22. 製品とポートフォリオ > Business Data Cloud > 顧客ランドスケープ > フォーメーション にアクセスし、「フォーメーションの作成」をクリックします。
  23. フォーメーション名とフォーメーションタイプを入力してください
  24. 次に、SAP BDCテナントを選択し、この特定のフォーメーションに追加して同期させます。
  25. 「次へ」をクリックしてフォーメーションの作成を続行してください。

これで、SAP BDC コアのプロビジョニングが正常に完了し、BDC コックピットにアクセスする準備が整いました。

SAP BDCテナントの解除

SAP Business Data Cloud、SAP Datasphere、およびSAP Analytics CloudテナントがSAP for Me でプロビジョニングされると、自分でプロビジョニング解除することはできません。
これらのテナントをプロビジョニング解除するには、次の手順に従います。

  1.  SAP Datasphere または SAP Analytics CloudテナントにSAP Business Data Cloud コンテンツがすでに存在する 場合は 、すべてのIntelligent Applicationsをアンインストールし、すべてのData Packageを非アクティブ化してから、テナントからすべての関連オブジェクトを削除します。
    カタログがSAP Databricks Unity カタログにマウントされている場合は 、マウントを解除します。
  2.  SAPサポートにケースを送信し、テナントのプロビジョニング解除をリクエストしてください。ケースにはサポートコード「BDC-CPT-PROV」を明記してください。

プロビジョニングサポート

プロビジョニングに関する問題がある場合は、 サポートチケットを開いてください。
問題に応じて、チケットに適切なサポート コードを指定してください。
SAP Business Data Cloud Provisioning - 一般およびコックピット : BDC-CPT-PROV
SAP Datasphere : DS-PROV
SAP Analytics Cloud : LOD-ANA-ADM-APS
SAP Databricks : 「SAP テクニカル サポートからのヘルプのリクエスト」を参照してください 。

entry.title: A question on SAP Marketing Cloud Coupons (and Offers)
entry.content:
Hello marketers experts!

We are starting to work with Offers and Coupons in SAP Marketing Cloud at my organization.

Since our coupons are generated by an external system, we mass upload them into Marketing Cloud through the "Manage Coupons" app. The coupon type and relationship type combination that best suits us is "Multiple Coupon Codes and Contact Assigned Dynamically"

Later, we create an Offer and we assign a target group to that Offer (because of the eligibility criteria).  That Static Target Group is the same that receives the campaign at the end. And we include the coupon cod on the email content we send in that campaign. We follow this process (Solved: Sending coupon via email in SAP Marketing Cloud - SAP Community)

After sending the email campaign with the offer code, I am requested to send the contact ID and the coupon cod that contact received through our email campaign, before the contact redeems it. Immediately after the campaign was sent or the coupon was assigned.

I tried visualizing that data through the Browse Interaction Data but it was not possible to see them from the standard view (I tried to add "coupon cod e" and wasn't there). I did see the coupon cod e assigned to a particular contact though, there at Browse Contact Interaction Data, I went inside each outbound email interaction and see the Offer and Coupon Section and there it was the coupon cod e assigned to the contact. Still, to do that for a lot of contacts is not efficient.

From the Analytics and Report Gallery Offer reports the coupons are not visible, I could just see offers. (We don't have SAC either)

I understand that SAP Marketing Cloud assigns the coupon codes randomly to the contacts present in the target group. And I want to mass extract that assignation of contact ID (or email ID, or interaction ID) and coupon cod assigned. Is that possible?

entry.title: Comunidade SAP RJ
entry.content:
COMUNIDADE SAP RJ EM MOVIMENTO! 

O SAP Inside Track São Paulo 2025 foi mais do que um evento: foi um lembrete do poder que a comunidade tem quando se une com propósito.

E agora, a pergunta que ecoa entre os cariocas apaixonados por SAP é só uma:

👉Quando será o nosso?

Se você é do Rio de Janeiro e quer ver a nossa comunidade crescer, se fortalecer e ocupar seu espaço no cenário nacional, esse é o momento de se movimentar.

💬Queremos te ouvir.

💡Queremos te ver palestrando.

📍Queremos te encontrar no próximo meetup.

🤝Queremos cocriar o futuro do SAP no Rio.

 

Não importa se você é júnior ou sênior, ABAP ou funcional, o que importa é estar junto.

 

Se você participou do SIT SP 2025, conta aqui o que mais te marcou.

Se você é do RJ e quer um evento nosso: comenta, compartilha e se conecta.

Vamos mostrar que a comunidade SAP carioca tem voz, tem força e tem história pra contar.

entry.title: Re: View payment proposal that was created using ‘Automat...

However I found that Urszula had priovided the answer in her question. When I used the Revise Payment Proposal app it listed the proposals and I could use the details button ">" to find the list of proposed or exceptions to payments that I expected. It can also be accessed in the Manage Automatic Payments app via the details button ">"  next to the proposal.

entry.title: Re: G/L OIM issue
entry.content:
Hello @SAM123567 ,

You cannot simply deactivate and reactivate OIM without cleansing the BSIS,BSAS and other such tables. SAP locks the account if inconsistencies are found in the line item and index tables.

1. If you really want to reset OIM from scratch, deactivate OIM using transaction FAGL_ACTIVATE_OP. Clean index tables manually or via program RFSEPA03 (consult SAP note first). Delete entries in BSIS/BSAS for that account before reactivation. Then re-activate OIM with the correct switch-on date.
2. Another option is to run transaction SE38, and execute program RFSEPA01 (check/repair open item management inconsistencies). It compares BSIS/BSAS with BSEG. If inconsistencies are found, you may be able to correct them with RFSEPA02 (use carefully in non-prod first!). This is "Consulting Solution" - use with extreme caution. 

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Role for Manufacturer
entry.content:
Hello @KeLaw,

Try below two options and let me know.

1.Create Manufacturer BPs Without a Supplier Role.Create a new BP without assigning any purchasing-related roles like FLVN00 or FLVN01. These BPs will act as manufacturers only and will not appear in supplier-related F4 helps, ensuring a clear separation. Assign only the "000000 – General Role" or optionally, create a custom BP role (non-transactional).
2. Assign Manufacturer to Material Master. In the “Purchasing” view of the Material Master, Field: Manufacturer (MFRNR). Use the F4 help to select from existing BPs (you’ll see all BPs, so naming or grouping becomes important)

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Setup a new ledger in the year of brown field conversion
entry.content:
Hello @HTO ,

1. Add the tax ledger after the first fiscal year post-conversion. This is SAP’s recommended approach. Complete the S/4HANA brownfield conversion with only the HGB ledger. Start the tax ledger in the next fiscal year (e.g., FY 2026).
2. Other option is use extension Ledger temporarily, only for simulation. SAP allows extension ledgers, which do not store actual transactional data, but overlay adjustments on top of a base ledger. You can create an extension ledger for tax view. Post adjustment entries manually (or via BADI) that simulate tax effects. Use this for reporting only, not legal postings.  Please note - extension ledgers cannot be used for Asset Accounting or depreciation calculations—they’re for reporting only.

However, consult SAP for appropriate approach.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Tax id rule setting in SAP (Taiwan)
entry.content:
Hello @SM1970 ,

In Taiwan, companies are legally required to validate Tax ID (VAT Registration Number) structure. I guess your are referring to same only. If that's the case then, enable tax number categories. For BP or customer/vendor tax ID setup, Go to OY17: Define tax number categories. Example: TW – VAT Reg. No. Now, go to OY18: Assign tax number categories to country (TW).


Secondly, maintain validation rule using user exit or BADI (BADI_FITV_SUBSTITUTE)
SAP does not natively validate Taiwan VAT ID logic (e.g., checksum). You can implement a custom validation via: User Exit EXIT_SAPMF02K_001 (Vendor Master validation). BADI or implicit enhancement in standard function.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: inventory audit report, with added 2-column input dat...
entry.content:
Hello @totommyng ,

Here is a complete ABAP report template for SAP ECC to generate an Inventory Audit Report with the following fields:

-Material (Item)
-Description
-Quantity (Today)
-Quantity (Cumulative)
-Value (Today)
-Value (Cumulative)
-Cost/Unit Today
-Cost/Unit (Old Date)
-Cost Variance (Absolute and %)

-Uses MSEG, MKPF, MARA, MAKT tables.
-Uses two date parameters: current date and comparison date.

I got the sample script from my friend.

This is a classical ABAP report with ALV output.
If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

ABAP CODE is as follow:-

REPORT zinventory_audit_report.

TABLES: mara, makt, mseg, mkpf.

TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_output,
matnr TYPE matnr,
maktx TYPE maktx,
qty_today TYPE menge_d,
qty_cum TYPE menge_d,
val_today TYPE dmbtr,
val_cum TYPE dmbtr,
cpu_today TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
cpu_old TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
var_abs TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
var_pct TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
END OF ty_output.

DATA: it_output TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_output,
wa_output TYPE ty_output.

DATA: lt_mseg TYPE TABLE OF mseg,
lt_mkpf TYPE TABLE OF mkpf,
lt_mara TYPE TABLE OF mara,
lt_makt TYPE TABLE OF makt.

DATA: lv_qty_today TYPE menge_d,
lv_qty_cum TYPE menge_d,
lv_val_today TYPE dmbtr,
lv_val_cum TYPE dmbtr,
lv_cpu_today TYPE p DECIMALS 2,
lv_cpu_old TYPE p DECIMALS 2.

PARAMETERS: p_date_curr TYPE budat OBLIGATORY DEFAULT sy-datum,
p_date_old TYPE budat OBLIGATORY.

SELECT-OPTIONS: s_matnr FOR mara-matnr.

START-OF-SELECTION.

SELECT * FROM mseg INTO TABLE lt_mseg
WHERE matnr IN s_matnr
AND bwart IN ('101', '102', '561', '562').

IF lt_mseg IS INITIAL.
MESSAGE 'No material movements found.' TYPE 'I'.
EXIT.
ENDIF.

LOOP AT lt_mseg INTO DATA(ls_mseg).
SELECT SINGLE * FROM mkpf INTO DATA(ls_mkpf)
WHERE mblnr = ls_mseg-mblnr
AND mjahr = ls_mseg-mjahr.

IF sy-subrc <> 0.
CONTINUE.
ENDIF.

CLEAR: lv_qty_today, lv_qty_cum, lv_val_today, lv_val_cum, lv_cpu_today, lv_cpu_old.

" Cumulative values
SELECT SUM( menge ) INTO lv_qty_cum
FROM mseg
WHERE matnr = ls_mseg-matnr
AND bwart IN ('101','102','561','562').

SELECT SUM( dmbtr ) INTO lv_val_cum
FROM mseg
WHERE matnr = ls_mseg-matnr
AND bwart IN ('101','102','561','562').

" Today's values
SELECT SUM( menge ) INTO lv_qty_today
FROM mseg AS m
INNER JOIN mkpf AS k ON m~mblnr = k~mblnr AND m~mjahr = k~mjahr
WHERE m~matnr = ls_mseg-matnr
AND k~budat = p_date_curr
AND m~bwart IN ('101','102','561','562').

SELECT SUM( dmbtr ) INTO lv_val_today
FROM mseg AS m
INNER JOIN mkpf AS k ON m~mblnr = k~mblnr AND m~mjahr = k~mjahr
WHERE m~matnr = ls_mseg-matnr
AND k~budat = p_date_curr
AND m~bwart IN ('101','102','561','562').

" Compute CPU today
IF lv_qty_today <> 0.
lv_cpu_today = lv_val_today / lv_qty_today.
ENDIF.

" Old Date CPU
SELECT SUM( menge ) AS qty, SUM( dmbtr ) AS val INTO @DATA(ls_old)
FROM mseg AS m
INNER JOIN mkpf AS k ON m~mblnr = k~mblnr AND m~mjahr = k~mjahr
WHERE m~matnr = @ls_mseg-matnr
AND k~budat = @p_date_old
AND m~bwart IN ('101','102','561','562').

IF ls_old-qty <> 0.
lv_cpu_old = ls_old-val / ls_old-qty.
ENDIF.

" Fill output
wa_output-matnr = ls_mseg-matnr.
SELECT SINGLE maktx INTO wa_output-maktx FROM makt
WHERE matnr = ls_mseg-matnr AND spras = 'E'.

wa_output-qty_today = lv_qty_today.
wa_output-qty_cum = lv_qty_cum.
wa_output-val_today = lv_val_today.
wa_output-val_cum = lv_val_cum.
wa_output-cpu_today = lv_cpu_today.
wa_output-cpu_old = lv_cpu_old.
wa_output-var_abs = lv_cpu_today - lv_cpu_old.

IF lv_cpu_old <> 0.
wa_output-var_pct = ( lv_cpu_today - lv_cpu_old ) / lv_cpu_old * 100.
ENDIF.

APPEND wa_output TO it_output.
CLEAR wa_output.
ENDLOOP.

IF it_output IS INITIAL.
MESSAGE 'No data found for selection.' TYPE 'I'.
EXIT.
ENDIF.

" Display with ALV
CALL FUNCTION 'REUSE_ALV_GRID_DISPLAY'
EXPORTING
i_structure_name = 'TY_OUTPUT'
TABLES
t_outtab = it_output.

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Hyderabad 2nd Edition: Join Us on 23 August 2025
entry.content:
We are pleased to announce the return of SAP Inside Track Hyderabad  2025  2nd Edition on 23 August 2025 . This  event promises to be an enhanced experience, bringing together SAP enthusiasts, experts, and professionals for a day dedicated to insightful sessions, networking opportunities, and discussions on innovation.

Registration is now open, and we encourage you to secure your participation for this highly anticipated event.

What is SAP Inside Track?   
SAP Inside Track is a community-driven event where SAP professionals, developers, consultants, architects, and leaders come together to share their knowledge and insights on various SAP-related topics. This grassroots initiative, organized by members of the SAP Community, provides a platform for fostering connections, staying updated on the latest SAP technologies, and gaining recognition for your technical expertise. 
Know more about SAP Inside Track Here!

 

Event Highlights

  1. Expert-Led Sessions
    • Keynote Speeches
    • Technical Deep Dives
    • Hands-On Workshops
  2. Networking Opportunities
    • Meet the Experts
    • Community Building

Why Attend?

  • Expand Your Knowledge: Gain insights into the latest SAP technologies and trends.
  • Enhance Your Skills: Participate in hands-on workshops and technical sessions.
  • Grow Your Network: Connect with like-minded professionals and industry experts.
  • Get Inspired: Discover new ideas and innovative solutions that can transform your business.

Event Details

  • Date: Aug 23, 2025
  • Time: 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM
  • Venue: CMRTC Group of Instituions, Hyderabad

We look forward to seeing you at SAP Inside Track Hyderabad 2025 2nd Edition! 

 

Navigate Your SAP Career Path being a Student

Are you looking to build a career in SAP? This is your opportunity to gain a clear understanding of what it takes.

You'll get insights into:

  • How to start career in SAP.

  • The essential SAP skilling roadmap to guide your learning journey.

  • The specific skills and competencies required to secure an SAP job.

Don't miss out on understanding the critical steps to accelerate your professional growth in the SAP ecosystem.

A Dedicated SAP Awarness Track for Institional Students 

Registration link for Students

@KatherineKenneally          @@marco_v_santo         lauraschmitz          Vidya_Chandran

 

Learning, Sharing, Networking & Empowering 

Thanks & Regards

SAP Community HYD

entry.title: Re: Activating the Status Based import in ChaRM
entry.content:
Hi All,

As of now we are performing the selective import every Friday into PRE-PRD systems via tasklist after cab approval. And also if  a user comes with a request to import the CD to PRE-PRD on any given day (not a emergency transport) we are doing it manually via task list. 

But going forward, we want to move through the automatic import job where there's no manual intervention in performing the imports via ChaRM. I understand that to achieve this, we need to change the import strategy to "Status Dependent import" and schedule the import job periodically to run on (eg: Friday-once in a week at specified time) via a specific task list.

On every Friday, we get a list of CD's to be moved to Pre-PRD and in that there are few CD's  which are interdependent with each other. ie a user want's to import his  / her CD's in sequence (CD#1 and then, CD#2 and CD#3...).

My questions:

1. If we scheduled the import job (with Status dependent import) to run weekly once on specific time, how the import interdependent CD's (CD#1 and then, CD#2 and CD#3...) will be handled? Does the auto import job is capable enough to identify the sequence of CD's (CD#1 and then, CD#2 and CD#3...) to be imported in sequence?

2. How to handle the CD(s) when a user(s) comes with their request to import one or two specific CD's on any given day (eg: Tuesday / Wednesday) and can not wait until Friday (as the auto import job is scheduled to run). I understand that when import strategy is  selected as "Status dependent Import" , there's no option to select the specific CD to import ( selective import). Is it still recommended to go with import strategy "Status dependent import" and inform the users to wait until next auto import job (ie Friday)?

3. Just to let you know that there no specific roles assigned to the system Type / system name / client.  we have given * for all the system type / system name / client / Roles in SPRO -> Specify import Transport request import strategy->import strategy view page.

 

So far we have been performing selective  import via task list in PRE-PRD and PRD. 

Please let me know what are the implications for the above mentioned approach if  we change the import strategy to "Status dependent import" from "Import with selection Popup" .

Regards,

Satish

entry.title: Re: What is the difference between the maintain and updat...
entry.content: Update is for updating dimension/model meta data including structure, properties, etc. Maintain is to maintain master data for dimension or fact data for model( including planning).

We are not considering SAP Task Center at the moment.

entry.title: Re: Sales order availability check
entry.content: Do you have other information and is this issue resolved.

entry.title: Re: Sales order availability check
entry.content: Do you have other information and is this issue resolved. For these type of issue, usually its related to the availablity check of materials. Can you test it on the testing system with 2 scenarios : + Idoc with the correct behavior material + Idoc with the incorrect behavior material +Va01 with correct behavior material + va01 with incorrect behavior material

entry.title: Re: Possibility for Mass Production Order Confirmation in...
entry.content:
Hello,

in Public Cloud you cannot get exactly the same result as in ECC. But you could do the following.

  • Build a custom app to read your Excel file
  • Use API to get the confirmation proposal by SAP (Link API Production order confirmation)
  • Use the data from the Excel and adjust the proposal provided by the API
  • Display the data to the user for manual adjustments
  • Execute the posting via API

Regards Johannes
Johannes Schulte | Senior SAP Expert
Email: johannes.schulte@vico-finconsulting.vicoland.com
On behalf of: Vicoland GmbH
Website: www.vicoland.com/sap

entry.title: Does the currency conversion of the group report meet three conversion logics simultaneously?
entry.content:
Dear SAP experts
Requirement:
Currency Conversion for Consolidated Financial Statements: Simultaneously Satisfying the Conversion Logic of Three Currencies under One Conversion Method (Z0920)
1. Number 010, month end currency exchange rate conversion, period end foreign currency amount * month end exchange rate
2. Number 040, default group currency amount, not converted
3. Number 050, fixed conversion currency exchange rate, ending foreign currency amount * fixed exchange rate


At present, the result of running on S4 Clound is: serial number 010 is correct, the rest are incorrect, and cannot meet my above requirements. The following is the data and configuration I ran, and which configuration is affected?

entry.title: Re: Offline Price Update for Purchasing Info Record via Microsoft Excel
entry.content: Hi, standard BAPI will create the condition record from upload date and end date as 31.12.9999. This will also automatically reduce the previous condition record to current date minus 1 . How can we achieve this for supplement condition as we want to keep track of price history with dates.
